item.title: Cape Town, Bru
item.description: Time has flown by since I’ve gotten here!

item.title: Rome Wasn't Built in a Day
CU&LP Trip - Peru Reflections
item.description: This past July, I traveled to Peru for approximately three weeks through ROTC’s CU&LP (Cultural Understanding and Language Proficiency) program with 30 other cadets from across the nation to train with the Peru’s Escuela Militar de Chorrillos, their version of the United States Military Academy.       One of the reasons I’m writing my blog post is because I have to discuss with my team leader on my takeaways from this mission and future leadership improvements, so apologies if some parts may seem a little robotic (sections taken from my evaluation).

item.title: About me
item.description: Lil Pump started on Soundcloud. Lil Gravy did too, but no one knows him. Drake definitely didn’t start from the bottom, contrary to his hit “Started from the Bottom”, but now he’s relatively successful.       Walt Disney had humble beginnings as a farm boy. He was also widely regarded as a racist.       Steve Jobs dropped out of college to travel the world and to find himself. Now, I can’t replace the battery on my cracked iPhone 6 Plus until I pay $200 to fix the screen just so the technicians can access the battery.

item.title: Building a Blog via Blogdown and Hugo
item.description: Intro This is a beginner’s tutorial to building a website through the R Package ‘Blogdown’ and Hugo. Install RStudio (https://www.rstudio.com/products/rstudio/) and R (https://www.r-project.org/) to get started. Open RStudio and navigate to File -> New Project… Then, in the ‘New Project’ popup menu, click on New Directory -> New Project. Feel free to name it whatever you like, and choose the directory location of your project. You should now be in an EMPTY directory (make sure it is empty besides the .
